item.title: Baseus 10-in-1 Charging Station Goes for Peanuts After 3 Price Drops, Now a Trending Hit on Amazon
item.content:encoded:
Our lives are dominated by long cables and fat adapters, invading our spaces creating unwanted clutter. Just about everything has a battery in it these days and requires daily charging. Your phone? Gotta plug it in. Your headphones? They used to just work, but now they‚Äôre Bluetooth so plug it in. Your watch? My old watch that just told time didn‚Äôt need it‚Äôs battery replaced for years. Now my Apple Watch needs to sit back in it‚Äôs wireless charger before I go to bed every night. Too many things need charging which means our desktops and nightstands are a tangled nightmare. Thankfully, that clutter can be reduced with a solid charging station. Baseus has a 10-in-1 desktop charger that right now is marked down 40%. Normally priced at $50, that $20 savings means you only have to pay $30 for a limited time.

This power strip combines 10 different ports all together, meaning you can charge up to 10 devices at once. You get a mix of six AC outlets, three USB-C ports, and one USB-A port. With a wide range of compatibility, you won‚Äôt have to use different charging blocks all assembled together. Just plug your devices cables directly to whichever port works. In case you do still need to use one on account of having to charge several USB devices, the power station itself is designed to allow for easy access to the AC outlets. With each facing a different direction, you won‚Äôt end up dealing with losing more than one outlet due to an extra chunky adapter.

Baseus‚Äô power station is designed for a a cleaner workspace. It actually comes with an adhesive strip intended for the underside of the unit. You can keep the power station firmly in place on your desk or nightstand.

Fast Charging

Your devices be it a phone, earbuds, or a MacBook can restore their charge super quickly as the Baseus 10-in-1 power station is able to deliver a maximum output of 67W. To put that in perspective, the USB-C adapter that comes with iPhones these days is only 20W.

With all these devices charging simultaneously, you may be worried about risk of overheating. Well, the Baseus power stirp utilizes GaN6 technology for safer, cooler charging. It‚Äôs been engineered for efficient heat dissipation soi you stuff can charge fast without getting hot.

Right now, Amazon has the Baseus 10-in-1 charging station for a reduced price of just $30. That‚Äôs a 40% discount down from it‚Äôs base price of $50. You‚Äôll save a whole $20 for a limited time.

item.title: Treyarch Co-Founder Sentenced To Federal Prison After Flying Drone Into Firefighting Aircraft In January
item.content:encoded:
Good morning. It‚Äôs Friday Eve, also known as Thursday. The weekend is almost here. I can feel it in my bones. While we wait, here‚Äôs today‚Äôs Morning Checkpoint, Kotaku‚Äòs daily round-up of video game news and other stuff you might care about. Today we have news about a Treyarch co-founder, a leaked Yakuza remake appears, Nvidia is making a big investment, and more KPop Demon Hunters is on the way in the near future.

Treyarch Co-Founder Peter Tripp Akemann Sentenced To Prison And House Arrest

In January, Peter Tripp Akemann flew a drone into a large firefighting aircraft that was helping to stop the horrible Palisades fire in the area around Los Angeles. The damage took the aircraft out of commission for a period of time. In February, Akemann pleaded guilty to the crime. And on Monday, Akemann was sentenced by U.S. District Judge Michael W. Fitzgerald to serve 14 days in federal prison, followed by 30 days of home arrest. Akemann, who helped create the studio that is now part of Activision‚Äôs massive Call of Duty machine, will also have to pay around $156,000 in various fines.

As part of a previous plea agreement, Akemann will also complete 150 hours of community service. His lawyers shared a message from the Treyarch co-founder earlier this year stating he was ‚Äúdeeply sorry‚Äù about damaging the aircraft and that he ‚Äúaccepts responsibility for his grave error in judgment, and is cooperating with the government in effort to make amends.‚Äù

Yakuza 3 Remake Accidentally Leaks Online

It looks like Yakuza 3, originally released in 2009 for the PlayStation 3, is getting a big ol‚Äô remake. That‚Äôs according to a leak fans spotted earlier this week on the Yakuza developer‚Äôs very own website. As reported by Engadget, Ryu Ga Gotoku Studios briefly listed Yakuza Kiwami 3 alongside two previously released remakes, Yakuza Kiwami and Yakuza Kiwami 2. However, Kiwami 3 has yet to be officially announced. Oops!

The listing has since been scrubbed from the site, but not before fans could document it via screenshots and social media posts. Many expect this new remake to be announced at the upcoming Tokyo Game Show later this month.

Microsoft Flight Sim 2024 Reportedly The Next Xbox Game Leaping To PS5

If you thought Xbox was done bringing more games to PlayStation 5, well, then you probably haven‚Äôt been paying attention to the company‚Äôs activity over the last year or so. Anyway, Xbox is, according to a new report from Polish news site PPE, porting Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 to the PS5. It‚Äôs claimed that this new port will be arriving in November of this year and will get a limited physical release. Xbox has yet to confirm, but this seems pretty likely to happen, and I expect an announcement soon.

Nvidia Investing $5 Billion Into Struggling Intel As Part Of Larger Partnership

Well, here‚Äôs something unexpected. Nvidia, one of the richest companies on the planet, is partnering with Intel, which has been struggling in recent years, as part of a large deal that involves the GPU giant investing $5 billion. The two companies issued a joint press release confirming the news and announced plans to work together to create ‚ÄúIntel x86 RTX SOCs‚Äù that will likely be used in devices like handheld PCs, laptops, and other portable electronics.

As you might expect, this deal also includes a lot of talk about how this will help boost AI performance and move the technology forward. With this investment, Nvidia is now one of Intel‚Äôs largest shareholders. Weirdly, the U.S. government is an even bigger shareholder after a wild deal was struck last month, giving the United States 10 percent ownership of the chip maker.

  • The most dangerous Xbox has been created
  • KPop Demon Hunters is getting a new short film soon

item.title: Hall-Of-Famer Hades Is Currently Cheaper Than A Big Mac
item.content:encoded:
Hades 2 has its long-awaited 1.0 release later this month, but if you haven‚Äôt played the first game yet, you should really start warming up with that first. Supergiant Games‚Äô 2020 GOTY contender is currently on sale to celebrate its five-year anniversary. You can grab Hades 1 for less than most meals on the McDonald‚Äôs menu. Your heart will be better off, too.

The action-RPG roguelike is about the son of Hades trying to escape the underworld and reach Mount Olympus. Players have to choose between competing upgrades and survive isometric bullet-hell battles to do so. A range of weapons and buildcrafting options, combined with incredible art and rich worldbuilding, make it an all-around exceptional game. Part classic arcade beat ‚Äôem up, part engrossing visual novel, Hades has something for everyone. Maybe that‚Äôs why it inspired Supergiant to make its first sequel.

Hades is normally $25, but right now it‚Äôs 75 percent off until September 30 on both Steam and the Switch eShop. At just $6.24, it‚Äôs a steal. If you don‚Äôt already own it on Switch 2, now‚Äôs the time.

Now I know what you‚Äôre thinking. Why buy Hades 1 when Hades 2 is just around the corner? The sequel launches September 25 after years in Early Access and is, on the surface at least, simply more Hades. But it tells a completely different story, stars a hero that‚Äôs more ranged-centric than the first game‚Äôs Zagreus, and is definitely harder overall.

Is this a Hollow Knight: Silksong situation? Based on my time with the Early Access version I‚Äôm not ready to say, but new players will definitely benefit from warming up in the first game and getting a feel for the flow and decision-making that comes with selecting between all of the different upgrade paths. And hell, by the time you actually finish Hades 1, maybe the second game will be on sale for $6.29 too.

item.title: Fixing Borderlands 4 PC Performance Is A ‚ÄòTop Priority‚Äô As Randy Pitchford Attempts Personal Tech Support For Angry Fans
item.content:encoded:
It‚Äôs been a fittingly chaotic launch week for Borderlands 4. The cacophony of player feedback ranges from praise for the best new entry in the loot shooter series since Borderlands 2 to very loud and angry complaints about bugs, crashes, and performance stutters on PC. Even the PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S versions have some weird issues. Gearbox Entertainment now says a second patch to address PC performance is on the way as it also investigates problems on console.

Not one to calmly monitor feedback from atop his 2K Games-funded Ivory Tower, studio CEO Randy Pitchford has been arguing almost nonstop with fans since the game released about whether their gripes about how it runs are legitimate or not. With Borderlands 4 sitting at at a mixed rating on Steam with just 65 percent positive reviews, the veteran poster has been handling criticism in classic Borderlands fashion.

Randy is now doing personal tech support for Twitter users and recommending 4x frame gen for a 5080 and telling them to turn off fog which is literally not an option in the game pic.twitter.com/WzRMiDO8Pt

‚Äî Paul Tassi (@PaulTassi) September 16, 2025

Here‚Äôs an abridged recap of the post-launch Pitchford timeline:

  • ‚ÄúCode your own engine and show us how it‚Äôs done, please.‚Äù ‚Äì September 13
  • ‚ÄúBorderlands 4 is a premium game made for premium gamers.‚Äù ‚Äì September 13
  • ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre not 4k stubborn and just want to have a great, fun time with higher perf, please consider running at 1440p resolution.‚Äù ‚Äì September 13
  • ‚ÄúFun facts: Customer Service reports for Borderlands 4 at roughly 1% or so of installs.‚Äù ‚Äì September 14
  • ‚ÄúI have personally helped users go from 30FPS to 90FPS+‚Äù ‚Äì September 14
  • ‚ÄúEvery PC gamer must accept the reality of the relationship between their hardware and what the software they are running is doing.‚Äù ‚Äì September 14
  • ‚ÄúThe game is pretty damn optimal‚Äù ‚Äì September 14
  • ‚ÄúPlease get a refund from Steam if you aren‚Äôt happy with it.‚Äù ‚Äì September 14
  • ‚ÄúWould you like help tuning with your personal specification?‚Äù ‚Äì September 16
  • ‚ÄúTurn down or off the volumetric fog‚Äù ‚Äì September 16
  • ‚ÄúOops. You are correct: the bottom setting for fog is ‚Äòlow‚Äô not ‚Äúoff‚Äù ‚Äì September 17

Reactions to this approach have been mixed. ‚ÄúAt what point do the crashouts stop making sense?‚Äù asked one player. Another claiming to be a game industry veteran who was definitely not Pitchford writing under an alias applauded:‚Äù ‚ÄúRandy Pitchford cares. He manically, catastrophically, awkwardly, SINCERELY cares.‚Äù I would simply add that this drama is as much a part of Borderlands at this point as the bandit psycho masks, terrible Claptrap puns, and glowing ammo hidden in toilets.

A second patch to fix Borderlands 4 on PC is on the way

Shroud's game crashed on Borderlands 4 and cost them all those legendaries RIPüòÖ pic.twitter.com/we3m1onoZp

‚Äî Jake Lucky (@JakeSucky) September 16, 2025

To help set the record straight or at least cut through the noise a bit, Gearbox released an official statement last night clarifying the team‚Äôs ongoing priorities as we approach Borderlands 4‚Äòs one-week anniversary. Here are the priorities following an emergency update over the weekend to try to improve optimization on PC:

  • We know some PC players are running into bugs and crashes. We hear you. Updates to improve stability and performance already started rolling out over the weekend and another is coming this Thursday. This is our top priority.
  • A Field of View [FOV] slider option for consoles is in testing right now and more information is coming very soon on that. Some console players have reported concerns with performance and we‚Äôre investigating those with planned updates coming.

The studio also released additional Shift codes for gold keys, including a Break Free Pack, to sweeten the deal with more bonus loot. At least one research firm has suggested Borderlands 4 has already sold over 2 million copies in its first couple of  days. Official player stats from Gearbox indicate 764,733,586 total items looted and 4,563,416 deaths by grenade as well as a quarter of all attempted boss fights being failed. I‚Äôm sure at least some of them will blame it on not being able to play Borderlands 4 at 120fps in 4K.
